intro: Clarkia virgata, commonly known as the Sierra clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and streambanks, preferring cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Clarkia virgata is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
